chi: （尤指為特定目的而經常）聚集在一起的人，（所有）與會者；集合，聚集

eng: help

engsen: Can I be of any assistance (= can I help) , madam ?

eng: a group of people who work together in a single organization for a particular purpose

eng: the fact of being involved with or connected to someone or something

eng: the fact of being involved with or connected to someone or something

engsen: This event was organized in association with a local school .

chi: 假定，假設；臆斷，想當然地認為

engsen: He assumed a look of indifference but I knew how he felt .

chi: 承擔，擔任；僭取，奪取；呈現，具有

engsen: The new president assumes office at midnight tonight .

chi: 承擔，擔任；僭取，奪取；呈現，具有

engsen: The terrorists assumed control of the plane and forced it to land in the desert .

chi: 承擔，擔任；僭取，奪取；呈現，具有

eng: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry

engsen: The unions assured the new owners of the workers' loyalty to the company .

chi: （尤指為消除其憂慮而）確定地對…說，向…保證，使確信；讓…放心
eng: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry

engsen: "Don't worry , your car will be ready tomorrow," the mechanic assured him .

chi: （尤指為消除其憂慮而）確定地對…說，向…保證，使確信；讓…放心
eng: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry

engsen: She assured him (that) the car would be ready the next day .

chi: 會議，大會；討論會，協商會
eng: an event, sometimes lasting a few days, at which there is a group of talks on a particular subject, or a meeting in which especially business matters are discussed formally
chisen: 婦女權利大會
engsen: a conference on women's rights

chi: 會議，大會；討論會，協商會
eng: an event, sometimes lasting a few days, at which there is a group of talks on a particular subject, or a meeting in which especially business matters are discussed formally
chisen: 他們常在那家飯店舉辦會議。
engsen: They frequently hold conferences at that hotel .

chi: 會議，大會；討論會，協商會
eng: an event, sometimes lasting a few days, at which there is a group of talks on a particular subject, or a meeting in which especially business matters are discussed formally
chisen: 我下週要在一個會議上發言／出席一個會議。
engsen: I'm speaking at/attending a conference next week .

chi: 坦白；供認，招認；承認（錯誤或罪行）
eng: to admit that you have done something wrong or something that you feel guilty or bad about
chisen: 她向丈夫坦白她賣掉了結婚戒指。
engsen: She confessed to her husband that she had sold her wedding ring .

chi: 坦白；供認，招認；承認（錯誤或罪行）
eng: to admit that you have done something wrong or something that you feel guilty or bad about
chisen: 他承認看這齣電影時大部分時間都在睡覺。
engsen: He confessed to sleeping/having slept through most of the movie .

chi: 坦白；供認，招認；承認（錯誤或罪行）
eng: to admit that you have done something wrong or something that you feel guilty or bad about
chisen: 他供認了謀殺罪行。
engsen: He has confessed to the murder .

chi: 自信；信心，把握；信賴，信任
eng: the quality of being certain of your abilities or of having trust in people, plans, or the future
chisen: 他有信心步入一間滿是陌生人的房間並馬上和人搭上話。
engsen: He has the confidence to walk into a room of strangers and immediately start a conversation .

chi: 自信；信心，把握；信賴，信任
eng: the quality of being certain of your abilities or of having trust in people, plans, or the future
chisen: 她一點自信也沒有。
engsen: She's completely lacking in confidence .

chi: 自信；信心，把握；信賴，信任
eng: the quality of being certain of your abilities or of having trust in people, plans, or the future
chisen: 我對她信心十足，她完全能勝任這份工作。
engsen: I have every/complete confidence in her . She'll be perfect for the job .

eng: a secret that you tell someone
chisen: 他們聊個不停，互訴心事。
engsen: They talked endlessly , exchanging confidences .

eng: to limit an activity, person, or problem in some way
chisen: 請把討論集中在正題上！
engsen: Let's confine our discussion to the matter in question , please !

eng: to limit an activity, person, or problem in some way
chisen: 請注意電話僅限於辦公用途。
engsen: Please confine your use of the phone to business calls .

eng: to limit an activity, person, or problem in some way
chisen: 透過關閉受感染的農場，我們希望把疾病限制在該地區的北部。
engsen: By closing the infected farms we're hoping to confine the disease to the north of the region (= stop it from spreading to other areas) .

chi: 困惑，糊塗；迷惑不解；混淆
eng: a situation in which people do not understand what is happening, what they should do or who someone or something is
chisen: 好像不是很清楚到底是誰作報告。
engsen: There seems to be some confusion over who is actually giving the talk .

chi: 困惑，糊塗；迷惑不解；混淆
eng: a situation in which people do not understand what is happening, what they should do or who someone or something is
chisen: 爲了避免混淆，這對雙胞胎從不穿一樣的衣服。
engsen: To avoid confusion , the twins never wore the same clothes .

eng: to praise someone and say that you approve of or are pleased about a special or unusual achievement
chisen: 我那時正在祝賀凱裡賽跑獲勝。
engsen: I was just congratulating Ceri on winning/on having won her race .

eng: a large formal meeting of representatives from countries or societies at which ideas are discussed and information is exchanged
chisen: 國際／醫學代表大會
engsen: an international/medical congress

eng: a large formal meeting of representatives from countries or societies at which ideas are discussed and information is exchanged
chisen: 澳大利亞工會委員會代表大會
engsen: the congress of the Australian Council of Trade Unions

eng: the situation in which events or conditions combine or happen together
chisen: 一連串不幸事件同時發生，導致了他的下臺。
engsen: An unfortunate conjunction of circumstances led to his downfall .

eng: the situation in which events or conditions combine or happen together
chisen: 有一個作家小組在合作撰寫這部書。
engsen: There is a team of writers working in conjunction (with each other) on the book .

eng: to take control or possession of foreign land, or a group of people, by force
chisen: 西班牙人在16世紀征服了新大陸。
engsen: The Spanish conquered the New World in the 16th century .

eng: to take control or possession of foreign land, or a group of people, by force
chisen: 諾曼人於1066年征服了英格蘭人。
engsen: The English were conquered by the Normans in 1066 .

eng: the part of you that judges how moral your own actions are and makes you feel guilty about bad things that you have done or things you feel responsible for
chisen: 問心有愧
engsen: a guilty conscience

eng: the part of you that judges how moral your own actions are and makes you feel guilty about bad things that you have done or things you feel responsible for
chisen: 事關良心
engsen: a question/matter of conscience

eng: the part of you that judges how moral your own actions are and makes you feel guilty about bad things that you have done or things you feel responsible for
chisen: 你沒做錯甚麽——你應該覺得問心無愧。
engsen: You didn't do anything wrong - you should have a clear conscience (= not feel guilty) .

chi: （常指不好或不利的）結果，後果
eng: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
chisen: 不立遺囑可能會給你的子女或者家庭其他成員帶來嚴重後果。
engsen: Not making a will can have serious consequences for your children and other family members .

chi: （常指不好或不利的）結果，後果
eng: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
chisen: 科學家們認為實際上不太可能會有甚麽物種因為石油洩漏而滅絕。
engsen: Scientists think it is unlikely that any species will actually become extinct as a consequence of the oil spill .

chi: （常指不好或不利的）結果，後果
eng: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
chisen: 我告訴理髮師就按她的想法來弄我的頭髮好了，可看看結果！
engsen: I told the hairdresser to do what she wanted to my hair , and look at the consequences !

chi: 作爲結果的；隨之而來的；由此引起的
eng: happening as a result of something
chisen: 我們使用有害化學物品且因此對環境造成了破壞，這是件非常嚴重的事情。
engsen: Our use of harmful chemicals and the consequent damage to the environment is a very serious matter .

eng: not usually liking or trusting change, especially sudden change
chisen: 保守的社會／觀念
engsen: a conservative society/outlook

eng: not usually liking or trusting change, especially sudden change
chisen: 上年紀的人往往很保守，對任何新的東西都有些懷疑。
engsen: Older people tend to be more conservative and a bit suspicious of anything new .

eng: A conservative guess or calculation is likely to be less than the real amount.
chisen: 我要是說失業人數有300萬的話，那是保守估計。
engsen: If I said there were three million unemployed , that would be a conservative estimate .

chi: 一貫的；堅持的；始終如一的
eng: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way
chisen: 她的態度一直在改進。
engsen: There has been a consistent improvement in her attitude .

chi: 一貫的；堅持的；始終如一的
eng: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way
chisen: 她工作有時不錯，問題是她不能始終如一。
engsen: Her work is sometimes good , but the problem is she's not consistent .

eng: in agreement with other facts or with typical or previous behaviour, or having the same principles as something else
chisen: 證人在法庭上的證供和他對警方的陳述不一致。
engsen: What the witness said in court was not consistent with the statement he made to the police .

eng: in agreement with other facts or with typical or previous behaviour, or having the same principles as something else
chisen: 我們認為他的行為與他位居要職的身份不相符。
engsen: We do not consider his behaviour to be consistent with the holding of a high-ranking job .

eng: to be or be considered as something
chisen: 最近的這次失敗是對民主黨的一次重挫。
engsen: This latest defeat constitutes a major setback for the Democrats .

eng: to form or make something
chisen: 女性在議會中約佔10%。
engsen: Women constitute about ten percent of Parliament .

eng: to form or make something
chisen: 18歲以下的人口佔該城鎮人口的近25%。
engsen: The under-18s constitute nearly 25 percent of the town's population .

eng: the set of political principles by which a state or organization is governed, especially in relation to the rights of the people it governs
chisen: 英國沒有成文憲法。
engsen: Britain has no written constitution .

eng: the set of political principles by which a state or organization is governed, especially in relation to the rights of the people it governs
chisen: 《美國憲法》
engsen: the Constitution of the United States

eng: the set of political principles by which a state or organization is governed, especially in relation to the rights of the people it governs
chisen: 根據工會章程，委員會必須每年改選一次。
engsen: Under (= as part of) the union constitution , a new committee is elected each year .

eng: the general state of someone's health
chisen: 他體格很強壯。
engsen: He has a very strong constitution .

eng: how something is made up of different parts
chisen: 化合物的結構
engsen: the constitution of a chemical compound

eng: to build something or put together different parts to form something whole
chisen: 建造新橋樑／大樓
engsen: to construct a new bridge/building

eng: to build something or put together different parts to form something whole
chisen: 牆是用混凝土建成的。
engsen: The walls are constructed of concrete .

eng: to build something or put together different parts to form something whole
chisen: 構思故事／造句／構築論點
engsen: to construct a story/sentence/argument

eng: the work of building or making something, especially buildings, bridges, etc.
chisen: 她從事建築行業。
engsen: She works in construction/in the construction industry .

eng: the work of building or making something, especially buildings, bridges, etc.
chisen: 這座橋樑是工程學和建築業的傑作。
engsen: The bridge is a marvellous work of engineering and construction .

eng: the work of building or making something, especially buildings, bridges, etc.
chisen: 該網站目前正在創建中。
engsen: This website is currently under construction (= being created) .

eng: the way in which the words in a sentence or phrase are arranged
chisen: 作者使用了幾個複雜的句法結構。
engsen: The writer has used several complex grammatical constructions .

eng: to understand something in a particular way
chisen: 他們怎麽能把一個毫無惡意的詞語理解爲譴責呢？
engsen: How can they put such a damning construction on a perfectly innocent phrase ?

chi: 建設性的；有益的；有用的；積極的
eng: If advice, criticism, or actions are constructive, they are useful and intended to help or improve something.
chisen: 她批評了我的作品，但是以一種非常建設性的方式——我受益匪淺。
engsen: She criticized my writing , but in a way that was very constructive .

chi: 建設性的；有益的；有用的；積極的
eng: If advice, criticism, or actions are constructive, they are useful and intended to help or improve something.
chisen: 要是你沒甚麽有用的話要說，最好保持安靜。
engsen: If you don't have anything constructive to say , it's better to say nothing .

eng: to get information or advice from a person, book, etc. with special knowledge on a particular subject
chisen: 如果症狀惡化就要去就醫。
engsen: If the symptoms get worse , consult your doctor .

eng: to get information or advice from a person, book, etc. with special knowledge on a particular subject
chisen: 我不是很清楚怎麽去那裡——我最好查查地圖。
engsen: I'm not quite sure how to get there - I'd better consult a map .

eng: someone who advises people on a particular subject
chisen: 管理／財務／電腦顧問
engsen: a management/financial/computer consultant

eng: someone who advises people on a particular subject
chisen: 公關顧問公司
engsen: a firm of public relations consultants

eng: to use fuel, energy, or time, especially in large amounts
chisen: 我們的高生活水準致使我們目前的人口要消耗世界石油的25%。
engsen: Our high living standards cause our current population to consume 25 percent of the world's oil .

eng: a person who buys goods or services for their own use
chisen: 新的費率會影響到所有用戶，包括工商企業。
engsen: The new rates will affect all consumers , including businesses .

chi: （尤指用於運輸或儲存的）容器
eng: a hollow object, such as a box or a bottle, that can be used for holding something, especially to carry or store it
chisen: 密封容器
engsen: an airtight container

chi: （尤指用於運輸或儲存的）容器
eng: a hollow object, such as a box or a bottle, that can be used for holding something, especially to carry or store it
chisen: 塑膠質地的飲品容器
engsen: a plastic drinks container

eng: pleased with your situation and not hoping for change or improvement
chisen: 他好像對生活相當滿足。
engsen: He seems fairly content with (his) life .

eng: pleased with your situation and not hoping for change or improvement
chisen: 他們滿足於只和一小群人交往。
engsen: They're content to socialize with a very small circle of people .

eng: a competition to do better than other people, usually in which prizes are given
chisen: 舞蹈／體育比賽
engsen: a dance/sports contest

eng: a competition to do better than other people, usually in which prizes are given
chisen: 她多次在選美大賽中獲勝。
engsen: She's won a lot of beauty contests .

chi: （為贏得選舉或權力而進行的）爭取，爭奪
eng: an attempt, usually against difficulties, to win an election or to get power or control
chisen: 該党領袖職務的競選爭奪非常激烈。
engsen: The contest for the leadership of the party was very bitter .

chi: （為贏得選舉或權力而進行的）爭取，爭奪
eng: an attempt, usually against difficulties, to win an election or to get power or control
chisen: 愛荷華州的初選是爭奪共和黨提名候選人的第一站。
engsen: The primary in Iowa is the first contest for the Republican nomination .

eng: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it
chisen: 結合歷史背景解讀他戲劇作品中所有的爭鬥和流血事件，這點很重要。
engsen: It is important to see all the fighting and bloodshed in his plays in historical context .

eng: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it
chisen: 這場小戰役在蘇格蘭歷史上非常重要。
engsen: This small battle is very important in the context of Scottish history .

eng: the text or speech that comes immediately before and after a particular phrase or piece of text and helps to explain its meaning
chisen: 在這個練習中，有一個單詞被抽去了，你必須根據上下文猜測這個單詞是甚麽。
engsen: In this exercise , a word is blanked out and you have to guess what it is by looking at the context .

chi: （通常指令人討厭或引起不便地）頻頻的，頻繁的，再三的
eng: happening repeatedly, usually in an annoying or not convenient way
chisen: 自從我買回這車，它就常常出毛病。
engsen: I've had continual problems with this car ever since I bought it .

chi: （通常指令人討厭或引起不便地）頻頻的，頻繁的，再三的
eng: happening repeatedly, usually in an annoying or not convenient way
chisen: 對不起——干擾不斷，我無法工作。
engsen: I'm sorry - I can't work with these continual interruptions .

eng: without a pause or interruption
chisen: 我的電腦不停地發出低沈的嗡嗡聲。
engsen: My computer makes a continuous low buzzing noise .

eng: without a pause or interruption
chisen: 馬路中間白色實線表示禁止超車。
engsen: A continuous whiteline (= line without spaces) in the middle of the road means no overtaking .

chi: 相反；反面；對立面；相反事物
eng: the opposite
chisen: 我原來擔心那可能對我來說太難了，可是我發現恰恰相反。
engsen: I was worried that it might be too hard for me but it turned out the contrary was true .

eng: an obvious difference between two or more things
chisen: 我喜歡白色長褲與黑色外套形成的對比。
engsen: I like the contrast of the white trousers with the black jacket .

eng: an obvious difference between two or more things
chisen: 這座建築物的古典裝飾與它自身的現代風格形成了不同尋常的對比。
engsen: The antique furnishing provides an unusual contrast to the modernity of the building .

eng: an obvious difference between two or more things
chisen: 他的性格與她形成了鮮明對比。
engsen: There's a marked contrast between his character and hers .

eng: to give something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people
chisen: 你不打算湊一份錢給傑克買送別禮物嗎？
engsen: Aren't you going to contribute towards Jack's leaving present ?

eng: to give something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people
chisen: 要是你覺得有甚麽要講的就來開會吧。
engsen: Come to the meeting if you feel you have something to contribute .

eng: to give something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people
chisen: 她家給這項基金捐了五萬美元。
engsen: Her family has contributed $50,000 to the fund .

chi: 貢獻，奉獻；捐款；捐助（物）；投稿
eng: something that you contribute or do to help produce or achieve something together with other people, or to help make something successful
chisen: 所有捐款，無論多少，我們都深表感謝。
engsen: All contributions (= presents of money) , no matter how small , will be much appreciated .

chi: 貢獻，奉獻；捐款；捐助（物）；投稿
eng: something that you contribute or do to help produce or achieve something together with other people, or to help make something successful
chisen: 投給校刊的所有稿件截止到8月1日。
engsen: All contributions (= articles to be printed) for the school magazine must be received by 1 August .

chi: 貢獻，奉獻；捐款；捐助（物）；投稿
eng: something that you contribute or do to help produce or achieve something together with other people, or to help make something successful
chisen: 這項發明對道路安全作出了卓越貢獻。
engsen: This invention made a major contribution to road safety .

eng: the state of being convenient
chisen: 我喜歡住在工作地點附近，這樣很方便。
engsen: I like the convenience of living close to work .

eng: the state of being convenient
chisen: 為了方便，我打算在我的新居收拾好之前先住在我母親那裡。
engsen: Just for convenience , I'm going to live at my mother's place until my new apartment is ready .

chi: （通常指房子裡的）便利設施；方便裝置
eng: a device or machine, usually in the house, that operates quickly and needs little effort
chisen: 這所房子裡現代化便利設施一應俱全。
engsen: The house has every modern convenience .

eng: a large formal meeting of people who do a particular job or have a similar interest, or a large meeting for a political party
chisen: 民主黨全國大會
engsen: the national Democratic convention

eng: a large formal meeting of people who do a particular job or have a similar interest, or a large meeting for a political party
chisen: 他們在哪裡召開黨員大會？
engsen: Where are they holding their party convention ?

chi: 傳統；（尤指社會）習俗，常規，慣例
eng: a usual or accepted way of behaving, especially in social situations, often following an old way of thinking or a custom in one particular society
chisen: 他們離經叛道，放棄了工作，開始過自給自足的生活。
engsen: They defied/flouted/broke with convention by giving up their jobs and becoming self-sufficient .

chi: 傳統；（尤指社會）習俗，常規，慣例
eng: a usual or accepted way of behaving, especially in social situations, often following an old way of thinking or a custom in one particular society
chisen: 根據習俗，應由男人向女人求婚而不是反過來。
engsen: Convention dictates that it is the man who asks the woman to marry him and not the other way round .

chi: 傳統；（尤指社會）習俗，常規，慣例
eng: a usual or accepted way of behaving, especially in social situations, often following an old way of thinking or a custom in one particular society
chisen: 在葬禮上穿黑色的衣服是許多國家的習俗。
engsen: In many countries it is the/a convention to wear black at funerals .

eng: a formal agreement between country leaders, politicians, and states on a matter that involves them all
chisen: 日內瓦公約
engsen: the Geneva Convention

eng: a formal agreement between country leaders, politicians, and states on a matter that involves them all
chisen: 人權公約
engsen: a convention on human rights

eng: traditional and ordinary
chisen: 傳統婚禮
engsen: a conventional wedding

eng: traditional and ordinary
chisen: 我覺得他的藝術作品乏味俗套。
engsen: I find his art dull and conventional .

eng: the opposite
chisen: 在美國汽車靠右行駛，但在英國卻正好相反。
engsen: In the US , you drive on the right-hand side of the road , but in the UK the converse applies .

eng: the opposite
chisen: 可是，該原理的逆命題也有可能成立。
engsen: However , the converse of this theory may also be true .

chi: 表達，傳達（思想、感情或想法）
eng: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people
chisen: 他的詩歌表達了獻身宗教的強烈感情。
engsen: His poetry conveys a great sense of religious devotion .

chi: 表達，傳達（思想、感情或想法）
eng: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people
chisen: 請向家人轉達我們的哀思。
engsen: Please convey our condolences to the family .

chi: 表達，傳達（思想、感情或想法）
eng: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people
chisen: 在發言中，我竭力地表達我們大家對他所給予幫助的感激之情。
engsen: I tried to convey in my speech how grateful we all were for his help .

eng: to take or carry someone or something to a particular place
chisen: 這種貨物通常透過鐵路運輸。
engsen: The goods are usually conveyed by rail .

eng: to take or carry someone or something to a particular place
chisen: 你能替我給梅裡克先生傳個口信嗎？
engsen: Could you convey a message to Mr Merrick for me , please ?

eng: to persuade someone or make someone certain
chisen: 他使陪審團相信他是無辜的。
engsen: He managed to convince the jury of his innocence .

eng: to persuade someone or make someone certain
chisen: 要讓她相信她無需減肥是徒勞的。

chi: 顯然易見的；明白的，明顯的
eng: easily seen or understood

engsen: Harry's courage during his illness was evident to everyone .

eng: to make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

engsen: The threat of attack has been greatly exaggerated .

eng: to make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is
chisen: 不要言過其實——沒有那麼貴。
engsen: Don't exaggerate - it wasn't that expensive .

eng: to make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

engsen: I'm not exaggerating - it was the worst meal I've ever eaten in my life .

eng: someone who is taking an examination

engsen: Before the real test , the examinee is given a simple practice exercise .

eng: someone whose job is to decide how well someone has done in an examination

engsen: The candidates listed below have failed to satisfy the examiners .

engsen: Men are usually quite good at map-reading but Tim is the exception .

eng: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way
chisen: 每條規則都有例外。
engsen: There are exceptions to every rule .

eng: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way

engsen: I like all kinds of movies with the exception of (= but not) horror movies .

chi: 使筋疲力竭；使疲憊不堪
eng: to make someone extremely tired
chisen: 長途旅行後，孩子們疲憊不堪。
engsen: The long journey exhausted the children .

chi: 使筋疲力竭；使疲憊不堪
eng: to make someone extremely tired
chisen: 打掃累得我筋疲力盡。
engsen: I've exhausted myself with all that cleaning .

eng: to use something completely

engsen: How long will it be before the world's fuel supplies are exhausted ?

eng: to use something completely

engsen: I'm afraid he's exhausted my patience .

eng: to use something completely

eng: to show something publicly

engsen: In the summer the academy will exhibit several prints that are rarely seen .

eng: to show something publicly

chi: （使）（尺寸、數量或重要性）擴大，增加；（使）膨脹
eng: to increase in size, number, or importance, or to make something increase in this way

engsen: The air in the balloon expands when heated .

eng: to increase in size, number, or importance, or to make something increase in this way
chisen: 20世紀80年代他們擴大了零售業務。
engsen: They expanded their retail operations during the 1980s .

eng: the increase of something in size, number, or importance

chi: （尺寸、數量或重要性的）擴大，增加，擴展
eng: the increase of something in size, number, or importance
chisen: 拓展新的研究領域是可能的。
engsen: Expansion into new areas of research is possible .

chi: （尺寸、數量或重要性的）擴大，增加，擴展
eng: the increase of something in size, number, or importance

engsen: an expansion of industry

eng: relating to tests, especially scientific ones

engsen: The drug is still at the experimental stage (= is still being tested) .

eng: relating to tests, especially scientific ones

engsen: The changes to the distribution system are purely experimental at the moment .

eng: the details or reasons that someone gives to make something clear or easy to understand
chisen: 你可以向我簡要說明一下它的運作原理嗎？
engsen: Could you give me a quick explanation of how it works ?

eng: the details or reasons that someone gives to make something clear or easy to understand
chisen: 她是如何解釋她遲到的原因的？
engsen: What was her explanation for why she was late ?

eng: the details or reasons that someone gives to make something clear or easy to understand

engsen: The judge didn't believe his explanation that he had stolen the money in order to give it to charity .

eng: to search and discover (about something)

engsen: to explore space

eng: to search and discover (about something)
chisen: 探索農村地區，步行是最好的方法了。
engsen: The best way to explore the countryside is on foot .

eng: to search and discover (about something)
chisen: 孩子們去樹林裡觀察大自然了。
engsen: The children have gone exploring in the woods .

eng: the fact of something such as a bomb exploding

engsen: The explosion (= the intentional exploding) of nuclear devices in the Bikini Atoll was stopped in 1958 .

eng: a large increase in the number of something that happens very quickly

engsen: The government has had to take measures to halt the population explosion .

eng: the act of proving that something is wrong

engsen: the explosion of the conspiracy theories surrounding the death of the star

chi: 易爆炸的；會爆炸的；可能引起爆炸的
eng: exploding or able to explode easily

chi: 易爆炸的；會爆炸的；可能引起爆炸的
eng: exploding or able to explode easily

engsen: An explosive device (= a bomb) was found at one of the capital's busiest stations this morning .

engsen: The situation in some of America's cities has become explosive .

chi: （局勢）一觸即發的，爆炸性的；（情感）突然迸發的
eng: An explosive situation or emotion is one in which strong feelings are loudly or violently expressed.
chisen: 死刑是個極具爭議的話題。
engsen: Capital punishment is an explosive issue .

chi: （局勢）一觸即發的，爆炸性的；（情感）突然迸發的
eng: An explosive situation or emotion is one in which strong feelings are loudly or violently expressed.
chisen: 她個性火爆。
engsen: She has an explosive temper .

eng: An explosive increase is very large and quick.

engsen: The last few years have seen an explosive increase in the number of homeless people on our streets .

eng: to remove what is covering something so that it can be seen

engsen: The plaster on the walls has been removed to expose the original bricks underneath .

eng: to remove what is covering something so that it can be seen

engsen: You should always limit your exposure to the sun .

engsen: Even a brief exposure to radiation is very dangerous .

engsen: The exposure of the politician's love affair forced him to resign .

chi: （在報紙或電視上的）報導，宣傳，曝光

chi: （暴露於嚴寒而導致的）凍傷（病），受寒

engsen: We have plans to extend our house (= to make it bigger) .

engsen: We're planning to extend our publishing of children's books (= increase it) .

engsen: The Sahara Desert extends for miles .

eng: to reach, stretch, or continue

engsen: Rain is expected to extend to (= arrive in) all parts of the country by this evening .

engsen: The government is extending aid to people who have been affected by the earthquake .

eng: to include or affect someone or something

eng: to include or affect someone or something

engsen: The invitation did not extend to family members .

eng: of or on the face

eng: a place, especially including buildings, where a particular activity happens

engsen: a nuclear research facility

chi: （尤指包含多個建築物，有特定用途的）場所

engsen: a military facility

chi: （尤指包含多個建築物，有特定用途的）場所
eng: a place, especially including buildings, where a particular activity happens

engsen: a new sports facility

eng: an ability to do something easily or well

engsen: His facility for languages is astonishing .

eng: firm and not changing in your friendship with or support for a person or an organization, or in your belief in your principles

engsen: a faithful friend

eng: firm and not changing in your friendship with or support for a person or an organization, or in your belief in your principles

engsen: They are faithful supporters of the Labour Party .

engsen: His faithful old dog accompanied him everywhere he went .

chi: 如實的，絲毫不作改動的

eng: following a particular religion

engsen: faithful followers of Buddhism

engsen: The town's fame rests on its beautiful cathedral .

eng: extremely good

engsen: You look fantastic in that dress .

eng: extremely good

engsen: We had a fantastic time .

eng: extremely good

engsen: They won the tournament ? How fantastic !

chi: 幻想的；怪誕的，荒誕不經的

engsen: He drew fantastic animals with two heads and large wings .

engsen: She must be earning a fantastic amount of money .

eng: a pleasant situation that you enjoy thinking about but is unlikely to happen, or the activity of imagining things like this

engsen: Steve's favourite fantasy was to own a big house and a flashy car .

eng: a pleasant situation that you enjoy thinking about but is unlikely to happen, or the activity of imagining things like this

engsen: She retreated into a fantasy world , where she could be anything she wanted .

eng: A fatal illness, accident, etc. causes death.

engsen: This illness is fatal in almost all cases .

eng: A fatal illness, accident, etc. causes death.

engsen: the fatal shooting of an unarmed 15-year-old

eng: a special meal with very good food or a large meal for many people

engsen: a wedding feast

eng: something that is very enjoyable to see, hear, experience, etc.
chisen: 視覺盛宴
engsen: a visual feast

eng: something that is very enjoyable to see, hear, experience, etc.
chisen: 他做的菜既賞心悅目又讓人大飽口福。
engsen: His food is a feast for the eyes as well as the palate .

eng: a day on which a religious event or person is remembered and celebrated
chisen: 聖雅各節／逾越節
engsen: the Feast of St James/the Passover

eng: a day on which a religious event or person is remembered and celebrated
chisen: 一個穆斯林節日
engsen: a Muslim feast day

eng: a boat or ship for taking passengers and often vehicles across an area of water, especially as a regular service
chisen: 汽車渡船
engsen: a car ferry

eng: a boat or ship for taking passengers and often vehicles across an area of water, especially as a regular service
chisen: 我們將坐渡船去海峽群島。
engsen: We're going to the Channel Islands by/on the ferry .

eng: a boat or ship for taking passengers and often vehicles across an area of water, especially as a regular service
chisen: 我們乘渡船去了加來。
engsen: We took the ferry to Calais .

chi: （動物或植物）可繁殖的，能生育的，能結果的
eng: Fertile animals or plants are able to produce (a lot of) young or fruit.
chisen: 隨著年齡增長，人的生育能力逐漸下降。
engsen: People get less fertile as they get older .

eng: to go to another place to get something or someone and bring it, him, or her back
chisen: 你去另一個房間幫我把眼鏡拿過來好嗎？
engsen: Could you fetch me my glasses/fetch my glasses for me from the other room , please ?

chisen: 我要去車站接我母親。
engsen: I have to fetch my mother from the station .

eng: to be sold for a particular amount of money

engsen: The paintings fetched over a million dollars .

eng: to be sold for a particular amount of money

engsen: The house didn't fetch as much as she was hoping it would .

eng: to hit someone with the hand
chisen: 我狠狠地給了他一記耳光。
engsen: I fetched him a smart blow on the ear !

eng: the type of book or story that is written about imaginary characters and events and not based on real people and facts
chisen: 這本書是一部小說作品而並非史實陳述。
engsen: The book is a work of fiction and not intended as a historical account .

eng: the type of book or story that is written about imaginary characters and events and not based on real people and facts
chisen: 兒童小說作家
engsen: a writer of children's fiction

eng: physically violent and frightening
chisen: 猛烈的進攻／激烈的戰鬥
engsen: a fierce attack/battle

eng: physically violent and frightening
chisen: 上週末的激戰中兩人遭受槍擊。
engsen: Two men were shot during fierce fighting last weekend .

chi: 資金；財務管理；財政；金融
eng: (the management of) a supply of money
chisen: 財政部長
engsen: the minister of finance/the finance minister

chi: 資金；財務管理；財政；金融
eng: (the management of) a supply of money
chisen: 你需要和財務部的人談一談。
engsen: You need to speak to someone in the finance department .

chi: 資金；財務管理；財政；金融
eng: (the management of) a supply of money
chisen: 財務委員會掌管著學校的預算。
engsen: The finance committee controls the school's budget .

eng: a space in the wall of a room for a fire to burn in, or the decorated part that surrounds this space
chisen: 她把壁爐的灰燼掃掉。
engsen: She swept the ashes from the fireplace .

eng: to praise someone in order to make them feel attractive or important, sometimes in a way that is not sincere
chisen: 我知道他只是在討好我，因為他想借些錢。
engsen: I knew he was only flattering me because he wanted to borrow some money .

chi: 可變動的；靈活的；可變通的
eng: able to change or be changed easily according to the situation

chi: 可彎曲的；柔韌的；有彈性的

chi: 可彎曲的；柔韌的；有彈性的

eng: When a person is fluent, they can speak a language easily, well, and quickly.

eng: When a person is fluent, they can speak a language easily, well, and quickly.

eng: When you flush, you become red in the face, especially as a result of strong emotions, heat, or alcohol.

eng: When you flush, you become red in the face, especially as a result of strong emotions, heat, or alcohol.

eng: If you flush a toilet, or if a toilet flushes, its contents empty and it fills with water again.

engsen: I can't get the toilet to flush .

chi: （尤指官方）禁止，不許，阻止，妨礙

engsen: The law forbids the sale of cigarettes to people under the age of 16 .

engsen: We had to learn chemical formulas at school , but I can only remember H2O for water .

engsen: The remains of the Roman fort are well preserved .

eng: lucky

engsen: He was fortunate in his choice of assistant .

eng: lucky

engsen: It was fortunate that they had set out early because the traffic was terrible .

eng: an occasion when an organization, state, etc. is established

eng: the structures below the surface of the ground that support a building

engsen: It's not the duration of his absences from work so much as the frequency that worries me .

chi: （尤指聲波或無線電波每秒振動的）頻率

eng: a substance that is used to provide heat or power, usually by being burned

eng: being between two other related things, levels, or points

engsen: This novel is too difficult for intermediate students of English .

engsen: I worked all morning without interruption .

chi: 親密的；有性關係的；宜於密切關係的

engsen: The restaurant has a very intimate atmosphere .

engsen: They were planning to mount an invasion of the north of the country .

engsen: Be careful what you believe - her powers of invention (= ability to think of excuses , etc.) are well known .

eng: the act or process of examining a crime, problem, statement, etc. carefully, especially to discover the truth

chi: （對罪案、問題、陳述等的）調查，偵查（尤指為了發現真相）

eng: If an activity, situation, etc. involves something, that thing is a part of the activity, etc.

engsen: There's a track that leads directly to the reservoir .

chi: 傳說，傳奇故事；民間故事

engsen: She is writing a thesis on Irish legend and mythology .

engsen: He has admitted misleading the police about his movements on the night of the murder .

eng: to think you have understood someone or something when you have not

engsen: If you think that these transport problems can be solved by building more roads , you completely misunderstand the nature of the problem .

chi: 中等的；不過分的，適度的
eng: neither small nor large in size, amount, degree, or strength

engsen: The cabin is of moderate size - just right for a small family .

chi: 中等的；不過分的，適度的
eng: neither small nor large in size, amount, degree, or strength
chisen: 他是個飲酒有節制的人。
engsen: He's a moderate drinker .

chi: 中等的；不過分的，適度的
eng: neither small nor large in size, amount, degree, or strength

engsen: Imposing sanctions is a moderate action when you consider that the alternative is military intervention .

chi: （尤指政見）溫和的，不激烈的，不偏激的

engsen: The party includes both extremely conservative and moderate members .

eng: not large in size or amount, or not expensive

engsen: They live in a fairly modest house , considering their wealth .

eng: not large in size or amount, or not expensive

engsen: There has been a modest improvement/recovery in housing conditions for the poor .

eng: not large in size or amount, or not expensive

engsen: The party made modest gains in the elections , but nothing like the huge gains that were predicted .

eng: not usually talking about or making obvious your own abilities and achievements

engsen: He's very modest about his achievements .

eng: a person who has the job of watching or noticing particular things

eng: mainly

engsen: He is genuinely motivated by a desire to help people .

engsen: He's a bright enough student - he just lacks motivation .

eng: enthusiasm for doing something

engsen: There seems to be a lack of motivation among the employees .

eng: the need or reason for doing something

engsen: What was the motivation for the attack ?

eng: the need or reason for doing something

engsen: a mountainous region

engsen: He murmured sweet nothings (= romantic talk) in her ear .

eng: to represent or describe someone or something in a painting, film, book, or other artistic work

engsen: The painting portrays a beautiful young woman in a blue dress .

eng: to represent or describe someone or something in a painting, film, book, or other artistic work
chisen: 作家描寫了世紀之交一個小村莊的生活。
engsen: The writer portrays life in a small village at the turn of the century .

eng: to have or own something, or to have a particular quality
chisen: 我一張DVD光碟都沒有。
engsen: I don't possess a single DVD (= I don't have even one DVD) .

eng: to have or own something, or to have a particular quality

engsen: In the past the root of this plant was thought to possess magical powers .

engsen: Whatever possessed him to wear that appalling jacket !

eng: the fact that you have or own something

engsen: The possession of large amounts of money does not ensure happiness .

eng: the fact that you have or own something

engsen: I have in my possession a letter which may be of interest to you .

eng: the fact that you have or own something

engsen: He was found in possession of explosives .

eng: exact and accurate

engsen: The bunker's precise location is a closely guarded secret .

eng: exact and accurate

engsen: He caught me at the precise moment that I fainted .

eng: exact and accurate

engsen: There was a good turnout for the meeting - twelve of us to be precise .

engsen: Years of doing meticulous research had made her very precise in her working methods .

eng: to say that an event or action will happen in the future, especially as a result of knowledge or experience

engsen: It's still not possible to accurately predict the occurrence of earthquakes .

eng: to say that an event or action will happen in the future, especially as a result of knowledge or experience

engsen: Who could have predicted that within ten years he'd be in charge of the whole company ?

engsen: The hurricane is predicted to reach the coast tomorrow morning .

chi: 更可取的，更好的，較合適的

eng: the state of being pregnant

engsen: Most women feel sick in the mornings during their first months of pregnancy .

engsen: My first pregnancy was very straightforward - there were no complications .

eng: (of a woman and some female animals) having a baby or babies developing inside the womb

engsen: She's five and a half months pregnant .

eng: (of a woman and some female animals) having a baby or babies developing inside the womb
chisen: 我母親自從懷孕後就不吸煙了。
engsen: My mother stopped smoking when she became pregnant .

eng: (of a woman and some female animals) having a baby or babies developing inside the womb

engsen: He believes that men who get (= make) young girls pregnant should be severely punished .

chi: 意味深長的，意義重大的

engsen: There followed a pregnant pause in which both knew what the other was thinking but neither knew what to say .

eng: in grammar, a word that is used before a noun, a noun phrase, or a pronoun, connecting it to another word
chisen: 在 We jumped in the lake 和 She drove slowly down the track 這兩個句子中，in 和 down 是介詞。
engsen: In the sentences "We jumped in the lake" , and "She drove slowly down the track" , "in" and "down" are prepositions .

eng: a talk giving information about something

engsen: The speaker gave an interesting presentation on urban transport .

eng: the way something looks when it is shown to other people, or the way someone looks
chisen: 如果想要人們購買你的產品，包裝非常重要。
engsen: Presentation is important if you want people to buy your products .

eng: the act of keeping something the same or of preventing it from being damaged

engsen: There is great public concern about some of the chemicals used in food preservation .

eng: the act of keeping something the same or of preventing it from being damaged

engsen: The church is in a poor state of preservation (= has not been kept in good condition) .

eng: the act of keeping something the same or of preventing it from being damaged

engsen: The president has said that the government is committed to the preservation (= protection) of the country's national interests .

eng: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed

engsen: to preserve the environment

eng: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed
chisen: 我們想在改善市鎮設施的同時保存其特色。
engsen: We want to preserve the character of the town while improving the facilities .

eng: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed

engsen: The agreement preserved our right to limit trade in endangered species .

eng: the act of stopping something from happening or of stopping someone from doing something

engsen: The organization is committed to AIDS prevention and education .

eng: main or most important

engsen: This is a prime example of 1930s architecture .

eng: main or most important

engsen: the prime suspect in a murder investigation

eng: main or most important

engsen: a prime source of evidence

engsen: Primitive races colonized these islands 2,000 years ago .

engsen: The spiny anteater is a mammal , although a very primitive one .

eng: someone's right to keep their personal matters and relationships secret
chisen: 新法律旨在保護人們的隱私權。
engsen: The new law is designed to protect people's privacy .

chi: （特定個體或群體的）特權，特別待遇
eng: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich

chi: （特定個體或群體的）特權，特別待遇
eng: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich

eng: a set of actions that is the official or accepted way of doing something

eng: a set of actions that is the official or accepted way of doing something

engsen: It's a routine/standard surgical procedure .

eng: to continue as planned

engsen: Preparations for the festival are now proceeding smoothly .

eng: the process of making or growing goods to be sold

engsen: Coke is used in the production of steel .

engsen: We watched a video showing the various stages in the production of glass .

engsen: The company's new model will be going into production early next year .

engsen: He had an amazingly productive five years in which he managed to write four novels .

eng: a teacher of the highest rank in a department of a British university, or a teacher of high rank in an American university or college

engsen: a sociology professor

engsen: There is an old Arab proverb that everything you write or speak should pass through three gates : Is this kind ? Is this necessary ? Is this true ?

engsen: He claims that the constant aircraft noise has a bad psychological effect on the residents .

chisen: 教育心理學家
engsen: an educational psychologist

eng: the scientific study of the way the human mind works and how it influences behaviour, or the influence of a particular person's character on their behaviour

eng: the act of making information or stories available to people in a printed or electronic form

chi: 宣傳活動；宣傳，推廣；關注

engsen: I enjoy outdoor pursuits , like hiking and riding .

eng: the act of trying to achieve a plan, activity, or situation, usually over a long period of time
chisen: 公司為追求利潤不擇手段。
engsen: The company is ruthless in its pursuit of profit .

eng: the act of trying to achieve a plan, activity, or situation, usually over a long period of time
chisen: 工會為了爭取10%的加薪而罷工。
engsen: The union is on strike in pursuit of (= trying to achieve) a ten percent pay increase .

eng: to shake because you are very frightened or find something very funny, or to feel or show great fear
chisen: 我每次上飛機都嚇得渾身發抖。
engsen: Every time I get on a plane , I quake with fear .

eng: to shake because you are very frightened or find something very funny, or to feel or show great fear
chisen: 查理站在校長辦公室門外，嚇得直發抖。
engsen: Charlie stood outside the head teacher's office , quaking in his boots/shoes (= feeling very frightened) .

eng: to shake because you are very frightened or find something very funny, or to feel or show great fear
chisen: 這齣電影太有趣了，逗得我們捧腹大笑。
engsen: The play was so funny , we were all quaking with laughter .

eng: a phrase or short piece of writing taken from a longer work of literature, poetry, etc. or what someone else has said
chisen: 本書的起頁引用了亞伯拉罕‧林肯的一句話。
engsen: At the beginning of the book there's a quotation from Abraham Lincoln .

eng: the price that a person or company says they will charge to do a piece of work
chisen: 我們決定接受最低的報價。
engsen: We decided to go with the lowest quotation .

eng: the fact that a company's shares are being traded on a particular stock market
chisen: 股票上市要求的改變使得在這一股票市場上市帶來的優勢減弱了。
engsen: Changes in the listing rules have reduced the advantage of obtaining a quotation on this stock market .

chi: （一陣）盛怒；（一陣）狂怒；（一陣）暴怒
eng: (a period of) extreme or violent anger
chisen: 她突然暴跳如雷，很嚇人。
engsen: Her sudden towering rages were terrifying .

chi: （一陣）盛怒；（一陣）狂怒；（一陣）暴怒
eng: (a period of) extreme or violent anger
chisen: 以前從未見他如此狂怒，我被嚇壞了。
engsen: I was frightened because I had never seen him in such a rage before .

chi: （一陣）盛怒；（一陣）狂怒；（一陣）暴怒
eng: (a period of) extreme or violent anger
chisen: 微不足道的小錯誤就會使他大發雷霆。
engsen: He flew into a fit of rage over the smallest mistake .

eng: an exciting or entertaining event involving a lot of activity
chisen: 派對辦得熱鬧極了。
engsen: The party was a rage .

eng: rain, or the amount of rain that falls
chisen: 大雨讓這場比賽泡了湯。
engsen: Heavy rainfall ruined the match .

eng: rain, or the amount of rain that falls
chisen: 該地區年平均降雨量是750毫米。
engsen: The average annual rainfall in this region is 750 mm .

chi: 現實的；實事求是的；務實的
eng: accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes for the future
chisen: （在這一點上）我們還是現實一點吧——我根本就付不起那麽一大筆錢。
engsen: Let's be realistic (about this) - I just can't afford to pay that much money .

chi: 現實的；實事求是的；務實的
eng: accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes for the future
chisen: 給那麽點報酬還指望人們做這個工作，這是不現實的。
engsen: It isn't realistic to expect people to work for so little money .

chi: （試圖武裝推翻國家政治制度的）反抗者，造反者
eng: a person who is opposed to the political system in their country and tries to change it using force
chisen: 叛亂分子佔領了首都並成立了新政府。
engsen: The rebels took over the capital and set up a new government .

eng: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember
chisen: 這位老人回憶起戰前這座城市的樣子。
engsen: The old man recalled the city as it had been before the war .

eng: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember
chisen: 他記得一個多月前就已經把信寄出了。
engsen: He recalled (that) he had sent the letter over a month ago .

eng: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember
chisen: 你能記起昨晚發生甚麽了嗎？
engsen: Can you recall what happened last night ?

eng: to order the return of a person who belongs to an organization or of products made by a company
chisen: 戰爭爆發後大使就被召回了。
engsen: The ambassador was recalled when war broke out .

eng: to order the return of a person who belongs to an organization or of products made by a company
chisen: 由於沙門氏菌污染引起恐慌，該公司收回了幾千罐嬰兒食品。
engsen: The company recalled thousands of jars of baby food after a salmonella scare .

eng: a formal party at which important people are welcomed
chisen: 總統舉行招待會款待來訪的外國元首。
engsen: The president gave a reception for the visiting heads of state .

chi: （飯店或辦公樓的）接待處，服務台，前臺
eng: the place in a hotel or office building where people go when they first arrive
chisen: 要找我的話，到前臺問詢。
engsen: Ask for me at reception .

chi: （飯店或辦公樓的）接待處，服務台，前臺
eng: the place in a hotel or office building where people go when they first arrive
chisen: 我在接待處登了記。
engsen: I signed in at the reception desk .

chi: （收音機或電視信號）接收效果，接收質量
eng: the degree to which mobile phone, radio, or television signals are strong and clear
chisen: 電話信號在這兒的樹林裡特別差。
engsen: The phone reception is really bad out here in the woods .

chi: （收音機或電視信號）接收效果，接收質量
eng: the degree to which mobile phone, radio, or television signals are strong and clear
chisen: 我們住在小山頂上，所以收音機的收聽效果特別好。
engsen: We live on top of a hill and so we get excellent radio reception .

chi: （收音機或電視信號）接收效果，接收質量
eng: the degree to which mobile phone, radio, or television signals are strong and clear
chisen: 安裝一個新的數碼天線可能會改善接受效果。
engsen: A new digital antenna might improve your reception .

eng: the first year of infant school
chisen: 學前班／學前班老師
engsen: a reception class/teacher

eng: a set of instructions telling you how to prepare and cook food, including a list of what food is needed for this
chisen: 要做地道的南亞飯菜，只需遵照這些食譜即可。
engsen: For real South Asian food , just follow these recipes .

eng: a set of instructions telling you how to prepare and cook food, including a list of what food is needed for this
chisen: 你知不知道怎樣做很棒的全麥麵包？
engsen: Do you know a good recipe for wholemeal bread ?

eng: to say a piece of writing aloud from memory, or to publicly say a list of things
chisen: 她自豪地背誦《效忠誓言》。
engsen: She proudly recited the Pledge of Allegiance .

eng: to say a piece of writing aloud from memory, or to publicly say a list of things
chisen: 反對黨列舉出政府一大堆失誤之處。
engsen: The opposition party recited a long list of the government's failings .

eng: agreement that something is true or legal
chisen: 這是個新國家，希望在外交上得到國際社會的承認。
engsen: It's a new country , hoping for diplomatic recognition from the international community .

eng: agreement that something is true or legal
chisen: 越來越多的人認識到，這個國家再也無力充當一個核大國了。
engsen: There's a growing recognition that this country can no longer afford to be a nuclear power .

eng: the fact of knowing someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before
chisen: 戰後他回到家鄉時，發現一切已經面目全非了。
engsen: When he returned to his home town after the war , he found it had changed out of all/beyond all recognition (= it had changed so much that he no longer recognized it) .

chi: （在疾病或受傷之後）恢復健康
eng: the process of becoming well again after an illness or injury
chisen: 米拉手術後完全康復了。
engsen: Mira made a full recovery from the operation .

chi: （在疾病或受傷之後）恢復健康
eng: the process of becoming well again after an illness or injury
chisen: 抱歉聽到你生病了，希望你早日康復。
engsen: We're sorry to hear you're ill , and wish you a speedy recovery .

eng: (a way of) enjoying yourself when you are not working
chisen: 他最喜歡的消遣方式是打高爾夫球和玩拼字遊戲。
engsen: His favourite recreations are golf and playing Scrabble .

eng: (a way of) enjoying yourself when you are not working
chisen: 埃瑪唯一的消遣好像就是購物。
engsen: Emma's only form of recreation seems to be shopping .

eng: the act of making something exist or happen again
chisen: 歷史上最著名事件之一的再現
engsen: a recreation of one of the most famous events in history

chi: 分揀收集（垃圾）用於回收再用
eng: to sort and collect rubbish in order to treat it and produce useful materials that can be used again
chisen: 日本人將一半以上的廢紙回收利用。
engsen: The Japanese recycle more than half their waste paper .

chi: 分揀收集（垃圾）用於回收再用
eng: to sort and collect rubbish in order to treat it and produce useful materials that can be used again
chisen: 我是不是把這個瓶子扔了，或者你們回收？
engsen: Shall I just throw this bottle away , or do you recycle ?

eng: the act of making something, or of something becoming, smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.
chisen: 交通量的減少
engsen: a reduction in traffic

eng: the act of making something, or of something becoming, smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.
chisen: 大減價
engsen: huge price reductions

eng: a mention of something
chisen: 因為我知道發生了甚麽，所以就避開不談婚禮的事情。
engsen: Knowing what had happened , I avoided making any reference to (= mentioning) weddings .

eng: a mention of something
chisen: 現就3月15日貴函致覆。
engsen: I am writing with/in reference to (= in connection with) your letter of 15 March .

eng: a letter that is written by someone who knows you, to describe you and say if you are suitable for a job, course, etc.
chisen: 我以前的中學校長說他會為我寫一封很好的推薦信。
engsen: My old headteacher said he would write/give me a glowing (= very good) reference .

eng: a quick look at a book, piece of paper, etc. in order to find information and help
chisen: 他整場演講完全沒有參考自己面前的筆記。
engsen: He made the whole speech without reference to the notes in front of him .

chi: 反射（光、熱、聲等）；反映，映出（影像）
eng: If a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it.
chisen: 他在水中／鏡子裡／商店櫥窗玻璃上看到了自己的影像。
engsen: He saw himself reflected in the water/mirror/shop window .

chi: 反射（光、熱、聲等）；反映，映出（影像）
eng: If a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it.
chisen: 光在水面上産生反射。
engsen: The light reflected off the surface of the water .

eng: to show, express, or be a sign of something
chisen: 這些統計資料顯示出人們的消費習慣發生了變化。
engsen: The statistics reflect a change in people's spending habits .

chi: 深思，考慮，認真思考（尤指可能性或意見）
eng: to think carefully, especially about possibilities and opinions
chisen: 經理要求給他一些時間好好想一想（怎麽辦）。
engsen: The manager demanded time to reflect (on what to do) .

chi: 深思，考慮，認真思考（尤指可能性或意見）
eng: to think carefully, especially about possibilities and opinions
chisen: 她心想這很可能是她最後一次見他了。
engsen: She reflected that this was probably the last time she would see him .

chi: 映射；映照出的影像；反射
eng: the image of something in a mirror or on any reflective surface
chisen: 希臘神話中的那喀索斯愛上了自己在水池中的倒影。
engsen: In Greek mythology , Narcissus fell in love with his own reflection in a pool of water .

chi: 映射；映照出的影像；反射
eng: the image of something in a mirror or on any reflective surface
chisen: 他用銀箔圍住火爐來增加熱的反射。
engsen: He put silver foil around the fire to increase heat reflection .

chi: （光線、熱量、聲音或能量從表面的）反射
eng: the return of light, heat, sound, or energy from a surface
chisen: 他用銀箔圍住火爐來增加熱的反射。
engsen: He put silver foil around the fire to increase heat reflection .

eng: a sign or result of something
chisen: 街頭部署了士兵，這一情況顯示出政府是多麽驚恐。
engsen: The fact that soldiers are on the streets is a reflection of how terrified the government is .

eng: serious and careful thought
chisen: 經過審慎的思考，我認定以前是我錯了。
engsen: On reflection (= after considering it) , I decided I had been wrong .

eng: serious and careful thought
chisen: 她當了30年法官，所以她對司法制度的意見很值得一聽。
engsen: After 30 years as a judge , her reflections on/about justice were well worth listening to .

chi: 給…帶來（尤指不好的）影響的事情；招致對…非議的事情
eng: something that makes other people have a particular opinion about someone or something, especially a bad opinion
chisen: 學生考分低，這使我們的學校系統遭受非議。
engsen: Low test scores are a sad reflection on our school system .

chi: （尤指透過改變人的行為或事物的構造而）改革，改進，改造
eng: to make an improvement, especially by changing a person's behaviour or the structure of something
chisen: 誰將改革我們不公正的選舉制度呢？
engsen: Who will reform our unfair electoral system ?

chi: （尤指透過改變人的行為或事物的構造而）改革，改進，改造
eng: to make an improvement, especially by changing a person's behaviour or the structure of something
chisen: 我酗酒多年，但當醫生預計我只能再活六個月時，我就改過自新了。
engsen: For years I was an alcoholic , but I reformed when the doctors gave me six months to live .

chi: 使涼爽；使恢復精力；使振作精神
eng: to make someone less hot or tired
chisen: 那天晚上實在太熱，我沖了個涼水澡涼快一下。
engsen: It was such a hot night that I had a cold shower to refresh myself .

eng: a person who has escaped from their own country for political, religious, or economic reasons or because of a war
chisen: 數以千計的難民越過邊境逃入鄰國。
engsen: Thousands of refugees fled across the border .

eng: the act of refusing to do or accept something
chisen: 我們向當局申請旅遊簽證，但遭到斷然拒絕。
engsen: Our request for permission to travel met with/received a flat/point-blank (= complete) refusal from the authorities .

eng: the act of refusing to do or accept something
chisen: 環境保護乃我們當今社會的當務之急，但政府卻對此視而不見，實乃一大悲劇。
engsen: The government's refusal to see that the protection of the environment must be our first priority today is a great tragedy .

eng: about
chisen: 該公司的用人政策正受到質疑。
engsen: The company is being questioned regarding its employment policy .

eng: to put information, especially your name, into an official list or record
chisen: 我把車登記在我的名下。
engsen: I registered the car in my name .

eng: to put information, especially your name, into an official list or record
chisen: 所有外國人在到達後兩週內必須在當地警察局登記。
engsen: Within two weeks of arrival all foreigners had to register with the local police .

eng: to put information, especially your name, into an official list or record
chisen: 選修這門新課程的學生必須在四月底之前註冊。
engsen: Students have to register for the new course by the end of April .

eng: to record, show, or express something
chisen: 蓋氏計算器顯示輻射強度達到了危險級別。
engsen: The Geiger counter registered a dangerous level of radioactivity .

eng: to record, show, or express something
chisen: 地震太弱了，無法用裡氏震級顯示。
engsen: The earthquake was too small to register on the Richter scale .

eng: to record, show, or express something
chisen: 他的神情顯示出他對所看到的一切極不贊成。
engsen: His face registered extreme disapproval of what he had witnessed .

chi: （事物）受到注意，被意識到；（人）注意到，意識到
eng: If something registers, someone realizes it and if someone registers something, they realize it.
chisen: 我確實提到過地址，但是（他）聽沒聽進去，我就沒有把握了。
engsen: I did mention the address but I'm not sure that it registered (with him) .

chi: （事物）受到注意，被意識到；（人）注意到，意識到
eng: If something registers, someone realizes it and if someone registers something, they realize it.
chisen: 我幾乎沒有注意到他在那裡。
engsen: I scarcely registered the fact that he was there .

eng: If you register a letter or parcel, you send it using a special postal service, so that it will be dealt with in a special way and not be lost.
chisen: 掛號信
engsen: a registered letter

chi: （機動車輛的）牌照號碼，登記號碼
eng: the official set of numbers and letters shown on the front and back of a road vehicle
chisen: 警方正在查找一輛小型藍色轎車，車牌號爲 B34-ACS。
engsen: Police are looking for a small blue car with the registration number B34-ACS .

chi: （尤指使按照某種方式運作而）控制，管理，調節，調整
eng: to control something, especially by making it work in a particular way
chisen: 你可以透過調節恆溫器來控制室溫。
engsen: You can regulate the temperature in the house by adjusting the thermostat .

chi: （尤指使按照某種方式運作而）控制，管理，調節，調整
eng: to control something, especially by making it work in a particular way
chisen: 她媽媽嚴格控制她看電視的時間。
engsen: Her mother strictly regulates how much TV she can watch .

chi: 規則，條例，法規；控制，管理
eng: an official rule or the act of controlling something
chisen: 正確的程式在規章條例中有規定。
engsen: The correct procedure is laid down in the rules and regulations .

chi: 規則，條例，法規；控制，管理
eng: an official rule or the act of controlling something
chisen: 政府對通貨膨脹的控制
engsen: government regulation of inflation

chi: 拒絕；拒收；擯棄；拒絕相信
eng: the act of refusing to accept, use, or believe someone or something
chisen: 政府拒絕批准這些計劃使我們大受挫折。
engsen: The government's rejection of the plans is a setback for us .

eng: a member of your family
chisen: 我沒有幾個有血緣關係的親戚。
engsen: I don't have many blood relatives (= people related to me by birth rather than by marriage) .

eng: a member of your family
chisen: 她所有的近親／遠親都來參加她的婚禮了。
engsen: All her close/distant relatives came to the wedding .

eng: the feeling of being relaxed
chisen: 我釣魚是為了消遣放鬆。
engsen: I go fishing for relaxation .

eng: the act of making rules or the control of something less severe
chisen: 我不能允許任何放寬規定的做法。
engsen: I cannot allow any relaxation in/of the rules .

chi: 緩解，減輕，解除（疼痛或擔憂）；使寬心，使寬慰
eng: to make an unpleasant feeling, such as pain or worry, less strong
chisen: 醫生給她注射了一針嗎啡來止痛。
engsen: She was given a shot of morphine to relieve the pain .

chi: 緩解，減輕，解除（疼痛或擔憂）；使寬心，使寬慰
eng: to make an unpleasant feeling, such as pain or worry, less strong
chisen: 她在家學打字來打發無聊的時光。
engsen: She relieved her boredom at home by learning how to type .

eng: to provide relief for a bad situation or for people in need
chisen: 為了救濟饑民而提供的緊急食品援助
engsen: emergency food aid to help relieve the famine

chi: 撒尿，排尿（urinate 的禮貌性說法）
eng:
polite word for
urinate
chisen: 他走到一棵樹旁小解。
engsen: He proceeded to relieve himself against a tree .

eng: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
chisen: 我玩得很開心，都不願意離開了。
engsen: I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave .

eng: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
chisen: 很多父母都不願意和兒女們敞開心扉交談。
engsen: Many parents feel reluctant to talk openly with their children .

eng: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
chisen: 她說服了丈夫跟她一起去佛羅裡達旅遊，儘管他不太情願。
engsen: She persuaded her reluctant husband to take a trip to Florida with her .

eng: to give a spoken statement of an opinion or thought
chisen: 約翰遜博士曾說道，「當一個人厭倦了倫敦時，他也就厭倦了人生。」
engsen: Dr Johnson once remarked (that) "When a man is tired of London , he is tired of life."

eng: to give a spoken statement of an opinion or thought
chisen: 他說她看上去很瘦。
engsen: He remarked that she was looking thin .

chi: 非凡的；奇異的；引人注目的
eng: unusual or special and therefore surprising and worth mentioning
chisen: 納爾遜．曼德拉確實是個了不起的人。
engsen: Nelson Mandela was a truly remarkable man .

chi: 非凡的；奇異的；引人注目的
eng: unusual or special and therefore surprising and worth mentioning
chisen: 能在羅馬這地方遇到你可真是驚人的巧合。
engsen: Meeting you here in Rome is a remarkable coincidence .

chi: 非凡的；奇異的；引人注目的
eng: unusual or special and therefore surprising and worth mentioning
chisen: 20世紀重大發明不斷，令人驚歎。
engsen: The 20th century was remarkable for its inventions .

chi: 療法，治療；補救（辦法），糾正（辦法）
eng: a successful way of curing an illness or dealing with a problem or difficulty
chisen: 用草藥治療頭痛的有效療法
engsen: an effective herbal remedy for headaches

chi: 療法，治療；補救（辦法），糾正（辦法）
eng: a successful way of curing an illness or dealing with a problem or difficulty
chisen: 排解憂傷的最好辦法就是努力工作。
engsen: The best remedy for grief is hard work .

eng: the act of doing or saying something again

engsen: a guide to common English usage

eng: the way a particular word in a language, or a language in general, is used
chisen: 關於這個詞用法的最早記載見於12世紀。
engsen: The earliest recorded usage of the word is in the twelfth century .

eng: the bad and unfair way someone treats you
chisen: 很多人都曾抱怨在他手下受到了不公待遇。
engsen: Many had complained about the usage they'd received at his hands .

eng: unsuccessful; of no value
chisen: 醫生們給他服用了更強效的藥，希望他能夠康復，卻是徒然。
engsen: The doctors gave him more powerful drugs in the vain hope that he might recover .

eng: unsuccessful; of no value
chisen: 他沒辦法欺騙自己說不覺得失望。
engsen: It was vain to pretend to himself that he was not disappointed .

eng: too interested in your own appearance or achievements
chisen: 他很虛榮，在髮型和衣著方面非常講究。
engsen: He was very vain about his hair and his clothes .

eng: extremely big
chisen: 大量的觀眾觀看了轉播。
engsen: A vast audience watched the broadcast .

eng: extremely big
chisen: 該書所包含的細節內容非常豐富。
engsen: The amount of detail the book contains is vast .

eng: extremely big
chisen: 那些聽從了我們建議的人省了一大筆錢。
engsen: The people who have taken our advice have saved themselves vast amounts/sums of money .

eng: a person who does not eat meat for health or religious reasons or because they want to avoid being cruel to animals
chisen: 在英國已有的400萬素食主義者中，將近三分之二是女性。
engsen: Of the four million people who have become vegetarians in this country , nearly two thirds are women .

eng: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience
chisen: run，keep 和 feel 都是動詞。
engsen: The words "run" , "keep" , and "feel" are all verbs .

eng: a large boat or a ship
chisen: 貨船／漁船／海軍艦艇／巡邏艇／帆船／補給船
engsen: a cargo/fishing/naval/patrol/sailing/supply vessel

eng: a curved container that is used to hold liquid
chisen: 挖掘過程中發現了一些古羅馬人的陶瓷器皿的殘片。
engsen: The remains of some Roman earthenware vessels were found during the dig .

eng: a person who has a particular quality or who is used for a particular purpose
chisen: 他是位充滿活力的年輕政治家，似乎是可以寄託國家希望的人。
engsen: As a young and spirited politician , he seems a worthy vessel for the nation's hopes .

eng: a tube that carries liquids such as blood through the body
chisen: 心臟病發作是由於向心肌供血的血管堵塞引起的。
engsen: A heart attack is caused by the blood vessels that supply the blood to the heart muscle getting blocked .

eng: a sharp-tasting liquid, made especially from sour wine, malt, or cider, that is used to add flavour to or to preserve food
chisen: 你要不要在沙拉裡加油和醋？
engsen: Would you like oil and vinegar on your salad ?

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 他們被控違犯了聯邦法律。
engsen: They were charged with violating federal law .

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 那些軍隊似乎是故意違反停火協議。
engsen: It seems that the troops deliberately violated the ceasefire agreement .

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 那名醫生被控違反了職業道德。
engsen: The doctor has been accused of violating professional ethics .

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: an action that breaks or acts against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 他聲稱他們如此對待他是對他的公民權／憲法所賦予的權利／人權的粗暴侵犯。
engsen: He claimed that the way he'd been treated was a gross violation of his civil/constitutional/human rights .

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: an action that breaks or acts against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 佔領大使館是公然違反國際法的行為。
engsen: The takeover of the embassy constitutes a flagrant/blatant violation of international law .

chi: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
eng: an action that breaks or acts against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
chisen: 很顯然他們的行為並沒有違反規章。
engsen: It was clear that they had not acted in violation of the rules .

eng: someone who has never had sex
chisen: 她三十多歲了還是處女之身。
engsen: She remained a virgin until she was over thirty .

eng: someone who has never had sex
chisen: 你覺得他還是童男嗎？
engsen: Do you think he's still a virgin ?

eng: a good moral quality in a person, or the general quality of being morally good
chisen: 耐心是一種美德。
engsen: Patience is a virtue .

eng: an advantage or good thing
chisen: 乘坐早一班的火車有甚麼好處呢？
engsen: Would there be any virtue in taking an earlier train ?

eng: an advantage or good thing
chisen: 看見這位女演員在電視上吹捧美髮產品的種種優點總是讓人感覺怪怪的。
engsen: The actress has appeared in many TV ads extolling (= praising) the virtues of hair products .

eng: because of; as a result of
chisen: 她成功靠的是堅韌不拔，而不是天賦。
engsen: She succeeded by virtue of her tenacity rather than her talent .

eng: an extremely small piece of organic material that causes disease in humans, animals, and plants
chisen: 水痘／流行性感冒／皰疹／流行性腮腺炎病毒
engsen: the chickenpox/flu/herpes/mumps virus

eng: an extremely small piece of organic material that causes disease in humans, animals, and plants
chisen: 有證據表明愛滋病病毒正在異性戀群體中迅速傳播。
engsen: Evidence suggested that the AIDS virus was spreading very quickly among the heterosexual community .

chi: 必不可少的；極其重要的
eng: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important
chisen: 有一個強大的反對黨對於健康的民主制度來說非常重要。
engsen: A strong opposition is vital to a healthy democracy .

chi: 必不可少的；極其重要的
eng: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important
chisen: 她已經查出了一些極為重要的資訊。
engsen: She had found out some information of vital importance .

chi: 必不可少的；極其重要的
eng: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important
chisen: 腎臟對於排除血液中的廢物起著至關重要的作用。
engsen: The kidney plays a vital role/part in the removal of waste products from the blood .

chi: 生機勃勃的；充滿生氣的
eng: energetic
chisen: 他從來沒有像現在一樣感到如此精神煥發，充滿活力。
engsen: He had never felt so vital and full of life .

eng: a mountain with a large, circular hole at the top through which lava (= hot liquid rock) gases, steam, and dust are or have been forced out
chisen: 死／休眠火山
engsen: an extinct/dormant volcano

eng: a mountain with a large, circular hole at the top through which lava (= hot liquid rock) gases, steam, and dust are or have been forced out
chisen: 活火山
engsen: an active volcano

eng: a mountain with a large, circular hole at the top through which lava (= hot liquid rock) gases, steam, and dust are or have been forced out
chisen: 火山噴發導致大量灰塵進入大氣平流層。
engsen: Erupting volcanoes discharge massive quantities of dust into the stratosphere .

eng: done, made, or given willingly, without being forced or paid to do it
chisen: 她每週志願為紅十字會服務兩天。
engsen: She does voluntary work for the Red Cross two days a week .

eng: done, made, or given willingly, without being forced or paid to do it
chisen: 他們選擇自願離職。
engsen: They chose to take voluntary redundancy .

chi: 自願參加者，（尤指幫助別人的）志願者
eng: a person who does something, especially helping other people, willingly and without being forced or paid to do it
chisen: 這家健康門診依靠志願者來負責辦公室的日常工作和接聽電話。
engsen: The Health clinic is relying on volunteers to run the office and answer the phones .

chi: 自願參加者，（尤指幫助別人的）志願者
eng: a person who does something, especially helping other people, willingly and without being forced or paid to do it
chisen: 由於那項任務非常危險，所以中尉請大家自告奮勇。
engsen: Since it would be a highly dangerous mission , the Lieutenant asked for volunteers .

chi: 自願參加者，（尤指幫助別人的）志願者
eng: a person who does something, especially helping other people, willingly and without being forced or paid to do it
chisen: 這是一支志願軍，沒有領軍餉的職業軍人。
engsen: It's a volunteer army with no paid professionals .

eng: a speech sound produced by humans when the breath flows out through the mouth without being blocked by the teeth, tongue, or lips
chisen: 短母音是諸如 cup 一詞中的短音。
engsen: A short vowel is a short sound as in the word "cup" .

eng: a speech sound produced by humans when the breath flows out through the mouth without being blocked by the teeth, tongue, or lips
chisen: 長母音是諸如 shoe 一詞中的長音。
engsen: A long vowel is a long sound as in the word "shoe" .

eng: a long journey, especially by ship
chisen: 他第一次出海航行時還是個年輕的水手。
engsen: He was a young sailor on his first sea voyage .

eng: a long journey, especially by ship
chisen: 談戀愛的第一年是彼此了解的階段。
engsen: The first year of a loving relationship is a voyage (= period) of discovery .

eng: a set of pages of information on the internet about a particular subject, published by a single person or organization
chisen: 欲知劍橋大學出版社其他圖書及課程詳情，請訪問我們的網站 www.cambridge.org。
engsen: For more information about other Cambridge publications and courses , visit our website at www.cambridge.org .

eng: happening once a week or every week
chisen: 週刊雜誌／每週報告
engsen: a weekly magazine/report

eng: happening once a week or every week
chisen: 每週都要對火警系統進行檢測。
engsen: The fire alarm has a weekly test/is tested weekly .

eng: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money
chisen: 你交的稅用作諸如失業和醫療等方面的福利救濟。
engsen: Your taxes pay for welfare benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay .

eng: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money
chisen: 她休了一個月病假之後，公司的福利主管約見了她。
engsen: After her month's sick leave , she was summoned to see the company's welfare officer .

eng: physical and mental health and happiness, especially of a person
chisen: 警方非常擔心失蹤兒童的安危。
engsen: The police are very concerned for the welfare of the missing child .

eng: physical and mental health and happiness, especially of a person
chisen: 這些機構竭力為移民爭取權利和福利。
engsen: These organizations have fought very hard for the rights and welfare of immigrants .

eng: the ability to use words in a clever and humorous way
chisen: 非常聰明且說話風趣的女人
engsen: a woman of great intelligence and wit

eng: the ability to use words in a clever and humorous way
chisen: 她的談話透著她特有的難以言傳的風趣與魅力。
engsen: Her conversation sparkled with her own subtle blend of wit and charm .

eng: the ability to use words in a clever and humorous way
chisen: 他以冷峻／機敏／機智的幽默而聞名。
engsen: He was known for his dry/ready/sharp wit .

eng: intelligence and the ability to think quickly
chisen: 她學會了靠自己的頭腦生存。
engsen: She learned to survive on her wits .

eng: a woman who is believed to have magical powers and who uses them to harm or help other people
chisen: 騎著掃把的女巫
engsen: a witch on a broomstick

eng: a woman who is believed to have magical powers and who uses them to harm or help other people
chisen: 從15世紀到17世紀，整個西歐的女巫都受到迫害，因為據稱她們與魔鬼有來往。
engsen: Witches were persecuted all over western Europe from the 15th to the 17th century , as it was claimed that they had dealings with the Devil .

chi: 抽回；取回；提取；撤回；撤離；退出；移回
eng: to take or move out or back, or to remove
chisen: 這張信用卡允許你每天從自動提款機中提取200英鎊。
engsen: This credit card allows you to withdraw up to £200 a day from ATMs .

chi: 抽回；取回；提取；撤回；撤離；退出；移回
eng: to take or move out or back, or to remove
chisen: 她因傷只好退出了比賽。
engsen: She had to withdraw from the competition because of a leg injury .

eng: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident
chisen: 警方呼籲那場事故的目擊者站出來。
engsen: Police are appealing for witnesses to the accident to come forward .

eng: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident
chisen: 據目擊者說，搶劫案是兩個十幾歲的少年做的。
engsen: According to (eye) witnesses , the robbery was carried out by two teenage boys .

eng: a person in a law court who says what they know about a legal case or a particular person
chisen: 在今天的審判中，將有兩名證人出庭作證。
engsen: Ten witnesses are expected to testify at the trial today .

eng: a person in a law court who says what they know about a legal case or a particular person
chisen: 原告的關鍵證人在受到死亡恐嚇後，得到警方的保護。
engsen: The key witness for the prosecution was offered police protection after she received death threats .

eng: to destroy or badly damage something
chisen: 爆炸震碎了附近的窗子，並毀壞了兩輛汽車。
engsen: The explosion shattered nearby windows and wrecked two cars .

eng: to destroy or badly damage something
chisen: 我們的溫室在昨晚的暴風雨中遭到破壞。
engsen: Our greenhouse was wrecked in last night's storm .

eng: a small line in the skin caused by old age
chisen: 眼晴周圍的細紋
engsen: fine wrinkles around the eyes

eng: a problem, usually a small one
chisen: 在協議簽訂之前還有一些小問題需要解決。
engsen: There are still a few wrinkles to iron out (= solve) before the agreement can be signed .

eng: every year or once every year
chisen: 我們每年加薪一次。
engsen: We get a yearly pay increase .

eng: every year or once every year
chisen: 利息按年支付。
engsen: Interest is paid yearly .

eng: a slightly sour, thick liquid made from milk with bacteria added to it, sometimes eaten plain and sometimes with sugar, fruit, etc. added
chisen: 我午餐只喝了一罐酸乳酪。
engsen: I only had a yogurt (= a container of this) for lunch .

chi: 年輕人特有的；富有青春活力的；朝氣蓬勃的
eng: having the qualities that are typical of young people
chisen: 當時我很羡慕他那年輕人特有的熱情。
engsen: At the time I admired his youthful enthusiasm .

chi: 年輕人特有的；富有青春活力的；朝氣蓬勃的
eng: having the qualities that are typical of young people
chisen: 她的皮膚非常細嫩。
engsen: She has very youthful skin .
